com.samysadi.acs.hardware.storage.operation

Interface StorageOperation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, LongOperation<StorageResource>, Notifier, Operation<StorageResource>, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StorageOperationDefault

    public interface StorageOperation
extends LongOperation<StorageResource>
    This interface defines methods to simulate a storage operation on a given StorageFile.

    When starting a storage operation, it seeks transfer rate resource from the parent storage of its StorageFile and keeps running until its entire length is processed (read, written or appended), until a failure happens or until it is explicitly stopped (using appropriate method).

    A storage operation can be created for a local file that is located in the same host with the operation, or for a remote file that is located on another host (ex: SAN storages).
    If the file is remote, then a NetworkOperation is also instantiated to handle the data transmission between the remote host and the local host. This operation is transparently synchronized with the network operation to run at the same speed and to be paused or to fail accordingly.

    You must ensure that the parent Job is started in order to start this operation, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.
    If you start this operation while it has a null parent then a NullPointerException is thrown.

    If your try to start this operation, while its StorageFile has a null storage parent or if that storage has null provisioner then a NullPointerException is thrown when star.

    Implementations have to listen and automatically stop the operation when:

    • NotificationCodes.OPERATION_RESOURCE_INVALIDATED The allocated TR for the operation changed;
    • CoreNotificationCodes.FAILURE_STATE_CHANGED The Storage fails. Or the device that contains the storage fails.
    All implementation classes should provide a constructor with four (4) arguments. The first specifies the StorageFile. The second specifies the StorageOperation.StorageOperationType. The third of long type specifies file position at which the operation will start. And the fourth specifies the operation length.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        StorageOperation clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones almost all children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone. The only children which are not cloned are those implementing the UncloneableEntity interface.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Operation<StorageResource>
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RunnableEntity

      • getStorageFile

        StorageFile getStorageFile()

      • setStorageFile

        void setStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile)
        Updates the StorageFile of this operation. The operation continues (and does not restart) on the new file.

        A NotificationCodes.SO_SF_CHANGED is also thrown.

        Parameters:
        storageFile -
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the operation cannot continue on the given file for any reason
        IllegalStateException - if the operation is running
